text.en: Have you heard anything about this?
Ugh. The stench of phosphorus is unbearable. I shouldn't stay here for long.
Ah, yes, yes!
Doesn't ring a bell, sorry.
I ain't tellin' you nothin'.
Know anything about this?
"Keeping Evil Spirits Off". Seems that he didn't get past the summary.
Someone's landed like a bag of bricks.
Trying to live beyond your means, young man?
A hard worker like Tom can only dream about visiting such a place.
And the puzzle comes together.
What's this smell all over the place?
Jim certainly doesn't come from money.
Hm, what if I change my clothes here?
Huh, Mrs. Hudson brought my mail.
Rare specimen he's got there. Must've spent a small fortune.
What's that, sulfur? Smells familiar.
Distinctly smells of sulfur.
Spending nights at the research. Admirable.
Not a single scratch on him.
He's already coughing blood. No wonder, working in a place like this.
"Dr. Bonker's British Heart Remedy". He got heart issues.
So much for the whole mystery.
Handwritten with fresh blood. Someone's got a great deal of dedication.
Met his death at an old age and in his own bed. The only missing part is "peacefully".
Whatever he saw before his demise - it wasn't pleasant.
I should clean up this mess. Someday.
Guess now people should start calling him One-Horned Jack.
The largest collection of crime researches in all of Britain. If to be proud of something it's this.
Apparently, broken in a hurry.
Glad that you're here, Mr. Holmes.
Hope you can shed some light on what happened here.
Sorry, mister, can't let you in.
His raincoat is still wet and dirty. Like he fell in the puddle on the way here.
This raincoat still has drops of water on it.
There were enough drinks for a company here, but not much left.
It's not that hot here to sweat, especially for the skinny man dressed that lightly.
The shoes are clean and polished.
This thick dirt is not from the streets, but rather from some kind of a ditch.
This smoking woman is rather slim.
The shoes are not shining, but clean enough.
No outerwear around, but her clothes are not wet.
Her shoes and skirt are all covered in dirt.
Drinking whiskey being so nervous and upset might be not the best option.
The raincoat of this strong man is still wet.
This is not my raincoat... Why do you even ask? Just leave me alone...
I'm not interested in your company, mister. There is plenty of free place not around me.
Stop staring at me, now! Or maybe you need your sniffy nose to be fixed by a good punch?!
Oh... mister... hic! Wanna pass a round? For all... hic... for the good men in the sea!
The last customers? A lady, a sailor, this sad youngster and Jimmy, our rude regular.
I don't talk about my customers.
Don't mess with my regular, Jimmy, he's got a short fuse. There he stands, on the far side of the counter.
Daniel Night-Dewis. Played dead a bit too well.
Wayne Carrick. Proof that God had a sense of humour.
Martin Domino. We stood together.
Arch Stanton. We knew you would be missed, but then they took another shot.
Huh. Almost an antique.
This one will only tell the right time twice a day.
This watch grabs attention! It is obviously very valuable. If the true owner is nearby, he might be searching for it.
Quality gold, it seems like. Must be worth a fortune!
A payment for the ship ticket. He wrote it in a hurry and put a blot.
That's enough for the police to catch him onboard... but there should be more useful info around.
Got his revolver full. I'd better warn Lestrade about that too.
A pricy cigarrets,  smoked up to the very end. A man with a moustache couldn't do so.
Cutting the pictures from the frames in such a way... what a savage.
There! He ran that way!
Guy thinks he can take my wares and just walk away! Of course, I can describe him. It was moments ago, he is still around...
Oh thank you, thank you good sir! Here is something for your trouble...
Give back or pay for what you have taken, or you are in for a walloping!
I believe this belongs to you.
Bah! It's not worth it. Here you are, choke on it!
How may I help you, good sir?
Yes?
C'mon lad, dunno a thing about dat!
Prepostorous! What is the meaning of this?
Go bother someone else!
I'm looking for someone, have you seen them?
I'm looking for an item. Does this look familiar to you?
Sure! Here's where you'll find them.
For sure! Just a moment while I write it down.
Never seen it, sorry.
Hm. A fake then.
There you are!
Still stinks. It's hard to get rid of the sewers smell from the clothes.
I hope I can follow the stains.
Small treasures of an amateur archeologist.
The note written on March 8 must be about this manhole.
It seems to be the place Nicholas mentioned in his March 17 note.
This pickaxe still has traces of dry mud and dust on it. It was used not less than a few days ago.
The door hinges are well-oiled and there is no rust on them. There should be a way to open this door.
Nicholas was forced to leave his belongings here.
The blood is mostly clotted. Whatever happened here, it was at least seven hours ago.
The oil in the lamp is almost burned. If it was full, then about eight hours passed after it was left here.
This is the manhole Nicholas was going to inspect on March 18. He can still be there.
It does not seem old man had time to use it.
A friend of this old fart? Hey, boys, there's another one!
Any news about my father, mister Holmes?
No signs of resistance. Need to take a note.
"With gratitude, to the great Mr. McDonagh."
Did not even finish his last drink.
My my, another young seeker with more curiosity than common sense.
Odd. This has been disturbed as well.
Fresh from the grave! He really wasted no time getting to Mr. McDonagh.
Not the nicest thing to do to your brother's image.
If anything... it's a logical thing to keep in a cold room.
A ghastly sight. They'll have to forgive me for intruding on their privacy.
The second fellow's neck is a mess. Could be hanging.
Something's wrong with this bottle, that's for sure. Can't put my finger on it though.
Odd...
Hm. Perhaps the undertaker saw someone.
Freshly dug.
This is just improper. Did they forget to put a name on it?
If anything, this mystery will keep me aesthetically engaged.
So that's where the portraits come from.
Do you know who this is?
Goethe's "Faust". A classic.
A strong sedative. Same kind Dougal took before his death...
Sedatives. Can't imagine they were added for the taste.
A man who's his own biggest fan is a sad sight. I'm fortunate I have Watson.
Must have taken quite a promenade to collect this much dirt.
Certainly spent his share of time outdoors.
Oh. Curious choice of decoration.
The man seems to have made quite a mark upon the island.
Now what do we have here...
Quality vintage. Wonder why Dougal didn't finish it.
Straight from some old lady's smile. Disgusting.
Pure as driven snow.
Interesting. I'll keep this in mind, should I become a struggling artist.
Quite chilly in here. Cold room must be a luxury on the island.
It's a shame to discover such art through so ghastly a story.
Dark as night. Or licorice.
And who would this handsome devil be?
Another lead. Best hold on to this.
Mr. Holmes.
Go ahead. My brother's bedroom is unlocked.
Come talk to me once you've looked the scene over.
Uhhh, don't touch that, please. We've had some recent repairs done.
Everything all right?
No idea. Now move along, I'm enjoying my leisure.
A hilt like that is definitely made for swift throws and catches. A tool of the juggler's trade.
A clean hit. Painless or not, the killer made it quick.
All blood-soaked. HIs own, I wonder?..
Whadda ya starin' at? Get lost!
I will plunder you if you open your mouth again.
Have you found them, mister?
All right, don't say you weren't warned!
Touch this and you'll eat dust, got it?!
All the bottles are here! The God sent you to save those lifes, mister!
And here's the stolen treasure... I've got to be more careful to not be stained in this slime.
Good day, officer. It seems you have a problem here?
The stolen gold was not so far as you could think, officer. I found it in the nearest sewer.
Officer, did someone move this truck?
Quite heavy. Weights around 12 kilos.
If you need something, Mr. Holmes, just ask me.
Oh, Mr. Holmes... I can give you everything I could figure out, if you're interested.
No... But we can, if you need it. Just wait a bit.
That's a very helpful fact - now we have one less thing to find.
Hmm... this powder smells peanuts.
All those classical tragedies requre talented actors to be performed decently.
Watson would say it is bad for health to use this.
Need anything else, mister Holmes?
Doubt you'll find something new here, Mr Holmes, but if you do, I'll be here.
It's a pity Watson is not here, when his medical knowledge is needed!
Could the boy eat one of those mushrooms?
According to the crumpled mushrooms, someone got throught this hole. But I'd better look for another way.
Pickles marked his knife as well as he could.
A strong smell of mushrooms. Oh, and here is the spore dust.
This may be convenient for the young urchins, but too tiresome for a gentleman.
I'm sure this is the psilocybe cyanescens.
I guess this is the telvana bisporigera shroom. But I'm not sure.
I guess this is the amanita parcivolvata. But I'm not sure.
I guess this is the boletus satanas. But I'm not sure.
Cut inaccurate, in a hurry.
Sure it is what happened here.
Please help us, Mr Holmes!
Oh... Mommy... oh... stars whirl, stars speak... oh... make them stop...
All those bags are dropped from the cart and scattered like someone jumped over them.
Looks like it's a part of a breathing mask. They usually use in mines.
The stain of a specific paint used by mine surveyors.
A shorty can possibly get throught this.
With some luck a man could hide here and sneak out, when the policemen entered.
The specific paint the sign is made with is more interesting than the sign. It is used by mine surveyors.
Empty. And here are dried stains of paint.
Only a heavy shoulder bag could leave such marks on a coat.
Paint has dried not so long time ago
Judging by the tracks, they were left by a man of short stature.
Empty. And with stains of dried paint.
No sign of crack open
These tracks left two tall men.
I don't understand, how did he manage to escape?..
Fresh-picked.
Hm... Yeah, I think I can help you with that.
Aw. That's a waste of herbs.
Someone brought their beliefs with them.
I wouldn't want to eat fish from this pond.
Miss Philipps did some grooming on her wards.
Oh, I see. I know a few places you can find them. But be careful, they'll upset your tummy!
Looks like something a witch would gather, not a herbalist.
The "changelings" came from a tiny cave and took Maude's offerings. However, they also brought odd mushrooms with them.
Let's see if there's anything special about it.
Little changelings were in a real hurry to leave their faerie land.
Crumbs are stale. Been here for a few days.
I can't possibly fit there, or I'll get stuck underwater. And stay in the faerie land forever.
Aiiieee!
Come back soon, Mr. Holmes! You may join us for dinner!
I'll keep looking for my performers. Your help would be appreciated.
Davekhmarot!
Watch yourself out there. Bogs are dangerous.
Piss off, foreigner. Nothing here for you.
Oh that's capital! We'll set off immediately. Lock and load, boys!
Looks like our thief is picky with his books.
What a relief, you found my prescious book! I won't leave it alone from now on, I promise.
I... Don't even want to know.
They say manuscripts don't burn. Let's see if same applies to old tomes.
Do they have all this plans in free access on Gollanza?
Priceless relic used as a can opener. Classy.
It's elementary, shotgun wound
Shells from two different firearms
I'm so glad you're here, Mr. Holmes! I'll tell you everything I know.
Yes? What can I help you with?
Excuse me sir, but this wing of the bank is currently closed for reconstruction work.
What have they done to you, my precious books! Maybe at least the History of Gollanza survived this horror...
Shots? Maybe someone needs help there
Someone left a clear footprint in this dirt. It has quite a distinct pattern.
Man injured, I need to quickly find a way there
Ah, Sherlock. Here to be the hero of the day?
Still warm, maybe the killer is also injured
You know, this time, I might actually beat you!
The policeman waits for your decision on this case, Mr. Holmes.
This place looks more like a hoarder den then a bookshop.
Holmes. When you have a theory, come talk to me.
Looks like, there is some seriously heavy traffic through this alley.
Sorry, have nothing to say about this.
Come talk to me, when you have a suspect, Holmes.
Those Swiss watch cost not less than the heavy golden casing.
Oh God, I hope I'm not late!
Many prints on the paint, he diameter fits the usual stethoscope's cup. Seems not only I'm interested what's inside!
According to the skin tone, he died from asphyxia.
Numerous bruises - he was fighting or hitting something hard.
"On the...anniversary... Your ..." So dirty that it's almost unreadable!
Better to double-check it with my tools.
The cheap oil paint is still wet under the thin upper layer.
The dook is blocked from the other side!
This heavy tobacco smoke smells really strong.
The blood had clotched at least a few days ago.
"Dupinki". The cheapest cigarettes on the island, with a strong rough smoke.
I'm sure that this dirt is from Old Town. Saw it near the cemetery.
"Dupinki" cigarette stumb. It still has its heavy rought smell.
There may be traces of paint on the cup, but I can't find them without a good magnifier.
Such a specific mud... I just have to find out where is it from.
Mrs Copello? Are you here?
Mr Copello, huh? He and his things are in the interrogation room. Our men are searching his office now.
Anything I can help you with?
This camera is totally broken! I can't do a single photo with it!
Many thanks! I thought I'll never finish this.
Please help me to get out of here, Mr Holmes!
The office is closed, only the police may enter. Leave now, mister.
Ugh, the smell... I hate this job. Won't be able to eat my wife's carbonada for a week!
Huh, you look nice, darling.
Get lost, buddy! You are not a hot chick like Mary and you're closing the view.
I don't feel well...
Spare a penny, mister?
Custom-made magnifier! It looks like the lens was pulled out of the telescope.
Do you hope the gentleman will help you, filthy beggar? Give up ya money, old wreck!
I feel like I'm missing something.
Lower that or I'll call the bobbies.
Don't hurt me, mister, I beg you!
This would make a great hat.
It won't open that easy now...
Some skin and hair stuck to the bloodied paper press. It happens when several strikes hit the same place on the head.
Broken with a rude force, most probably with the paper knife. That's not how the professional acts.
Seems that the old man loved his dog - such a frame sure costs a lot.
Someone took the ring off his hand. According to the scratches and wounds it happened after the death of the victim.
No traces of powder or even any smell on the hand. Seems he was not the one who pushed the trigger.
The deep cut wound going right through the artery. Certainly a fatal blow.
A Red Sash gang knife, covered in blood. Seems like the wound on the neck was made with it.
I should inspect his foot to be sure.
Such a strike would cause a fountain of blood, but there is only a small puddle. Was he killed somewhere else or already dead before being cut?
Seller: If you want, I can tell you more about this picture!
Penknife. Every boy dream about such a thing.
No name and no even autograph of the author. Judging by the state of the paint, this was painted no more than six months ago.
Still no name and no even autograph of the author. Judging by the state of the paint, this was painted no more than a year ago.
Crystals of copper sulfate. With sufficient knowledge of chemistry, such can be grown even at home.
What matters is not the flower, but the dirt on which it grows
It isn't the best place to break my disguise.
The barrel still smells of burned powder. The shooting happened recently.
Did you hear someone drew some strange signs all over the old Hospitaller graveyard? What kind of man would do this? And why?
This Highlander gang member was hanged. After that the murderer tried to stage the attack of the Red Sash gang - either to avert suspicion or to start a gang war.
So this was the word I need!
The blood gathered here after death. The man was hanged and it was the cause of his death.
The scimitars on the crest are facing outward. This figurine is fake.
A thistle tattoo - seems like the mark of the local Highlanders gang.
The back of his head is smashed with fierce blows.
Attention! Attention! Only from me you can buy the famous third painting of the Nameless Triptych!
So this is what Alfonso looks like. It shouldn't be so hard to find all I need in here.
A ligature mark. He was strangulated with a thick rope, most probably hanged.
Most probably the heir killed Albus Fairson with the paper press and tried to imitate the robbery after.
You have to go back to your roots...
Welcome back, Mr. Holmes!
"Property of S.H.". S. H...
An old photo of the man and a young boy smiling to the camera. It was cast down long ago and never touched again, according to the thick dust.
The lower you are, the easier it is for you to keep secrets.
The scimitars on the crest are supposed to face inward. This is the genuine one.
Still no name and no even autograph of the author. Judging by the state of the paint, this was painted several years ago.
All ammo is spent, not a single bullet left.
Excuse me, sir, you're not on the list.
Oh no, my boy is stuck on the second floor of this house, help him please.
Boss doesn't want visitors.
Do you know the pill peddler from the Old Town market? He bought an old relique and is looking for someone to help him to identify it! What if it's real and he'll become rich?
Choose the one you like, mister. Or maybe you need some guidance?
Wrong neighborhood, slug. Move on!
Gentleman, hey, need a ride? Any district, any time - for a fair price!
Hey, hey, ease up, man...
Lower it down, just lower it down...
You better keep away from here!
Hey, it's mine. Hands off, tramp
Help me, mister. Please. I just wanted to get some corn for my hungry little sister but they locked me here
Run to your mommy before the things get messy!
I press the button but nothing happens. I think I miss something
I told you, it's mine. Get over here!
Remember old Meoli? I heard he hid something in his yard in Old Town. Under a tree that one can carry in his hand... psst... he's listening...
I put my old sailor uniform in the wardrobe. Is it ok, Mr Holmes?
The pharmacist from the Old Town market looks for an expert in old figurines. Why did he even bought them if he doubts they're not fake?
If you were one of my men, I'd cut your salary for such weapon handling
Books, old books, wisdom of ages for the cheapest price possible!
This man? I saw someone like him here.
Oh hello Tommy, I didn't know it was you. Boss is waiting. You're my favorite bandit.
Poor boy, fire brigade will be here tomorrow..... as usual
Are you lost, buddy? We can help you to get lost.
Get back or you'll have your pretty face smashed!
Help, please, help me, mister! Please!
I thought only the tourists may be so naive, but the pharmacist from the Old Town market bought two figurines and I bet both are fake! He's looking for someone to evaluate them now...
This ugly guy? I guess I saw someone like him. Let me show you...
You can remove or edit this comment
I'm sure this plan will work. And now, gentlemen, let's give this man a proper welcome.
Bennett works? One can understand he was let go.
If one English city would build this, the inhabitants would kill themselves.
Lestrade told me once that we amputate too many soldiers and not enough painters. What should be done with soldiers that are painters?
Art books. Anatomy, light, composition,... Waste of time.
I don't think that the plaster dust make this place prettier.
"Baroness of Totington Emerald".
The roof is leaking, the boardhouse is poorly maintained.
Events happening around. Soldiers can enjoy Gollanza with them, or pretend to.
Bennett was here. He worked long hours to learn and Draw. Smoking, studying, and with an utterly depressing result. Still Flockhart believes in him. Why?
That is Bennett Service number. Used to identify soldiers if they die.
The mysterious Justin Flockhart. Who are you?
Selling 8 left shoes of different models, size 7,5. Cause : amputation.
The place is an old office, not a painter worshop.
If I can help you somehow, just ask.
Let's catch this criminal!
I'm confident we didn't repair the roof, sir. The building is properly maintained under my supervision.
Want to know something?
I know nothing about this.
That name doesn't sound familiar, was he one of our soldiers?
Good day to you, Holmes!
Never even heard about it!
It's an honor to work with you, Mr. Holmes!
Sure, I know about it.
Ha! Of course, I know. Listen closely.
Sorry, but I can't help you with this.
Sorry, but I don't know how I can help you with this.
How can I help you?
Yes, I think I can help you with this.
If I can help you somehow, just ask.
So, what is our plan, Holmes?
What a terrible way to die.
Oh my. I need to inform Mr. Barak.
Now this is unusual.
Tranquilizers! They tend to get the job done when you need someone helpless.
Hm. I need more information to work with.
Such savagery. No restraint.
Hm. I think I got it. Time to inform Placido.
Well... all artists start somewhere.
Quite some hobby our culprit has.
The kettle is still warm. Freshly heated.
Smouldering fabric... That explains the stench.
The young lady doesn't look too good.
This place is a den as it is. I wonder what the owner thought he had to hide.
Huh. Now that's something you don't expect from an honest citizen.
"...The princess pricked her finger with a spindle and fell upon the bed in a dead sleep..."
Lt. Placido is inside, sir. Waiting for you.
Sorry, know nothing about that.
Take a look around. See for yourself.
We got your back.
Please, sir. Find him. Make him pay.
I didn't do it. You've got nothing!
Stay calm, everyone, the lockdown is temporary.
Please don't interfere with the investigation.
Go away and be loud downstairs.
The victim had a massive bleeding, but the clothes are mostly clean.
Hm. I smell burnt fabric here.
Painted with blood. Show off.
A powerful blow straight to the liver. Brutal. Effective.
I am back from beyond the grave!
Interesting. The hand is dyed with paint or some kind of makeup.
Sorry, no idea.
Looks like Uzay's ring. Can't imagine a person to wear something this tasteless.
How many Karims are there in this city?
Always wanted to dress like that!
Did the victim crawl while wounded or was he dragged?
Cuts, tears and fresh blood. This Karim costume has seen some fighting.
It's Karim! In the middle of the day!
I am invincible and cannot be killed!
Yeah, I know what you're talking about.
It's him! Karim has returned!
I don't think that's stage blood on these clothes.
Look, it's Karim!
The same silver paint.
Fear not, people! Karim of the Silver Hand returned to protect you!
The man's all bruised and cut. He didn't go down without a fight.
True heroes never die!
The place looks almost like it hosted a locals' wedding.
Oh, this mess in your room is unbearable, signor Holmes!
Good day, Mr. Holmes.
Ah yes, I recognize this.
Sorry, amico, no idea. While you're here, give a look at these fine wares!
Ay, amico, what a fine sight you are!
Halt! The dressing room is for performers only!
I need a new cart now. Where am I supposed to get that much money?
Good to have you helping us, Mr. Holmes.
Need something, sir? I got the finest Indian fabrics!
Large pool of blood, according to police report victim's body was found here.
Shipyard - testimony says it all started from here.
Anonymous witness claims that suspects walked away from here after the fight.
Hm... It is possible that James Whinee's testimony are correct and it also means that other suspect and witness are lying! I wounder why so?
It is very likely that both suspects are lying! They both committed crime and now trying to hide it.
Let's see other options!
It does make sense!
I believe there is another version possible.
I should pay more attention to details.
Something is not quite right.
I need to find all possibilities for this crime!
This one seems possible.
I guess that is all!
Done. Let us proceed further.
Hm... A worthy interpretation.
I'm missing something here.
Reconstruction complete.
If this was a case of vandalism and robbery then criminals here aren't smarter than chicken.
What if intruder broke vase accidentally and stole painting to draw attention away from the real purpose of his uninvited visit?
This crime scene doesn't really look like a robbery. On other side, it is also possible that guard scared thief before he was able to do something.
Male usual worker shoes, size eight and a half.
A familiar scent.
Raw clay sphere. A sling bullet! Made to Stun. not to kill.
Heavy... Must be fine silver. It was left behind.
Tobacco, Coarse and cheap, balkan flavor, Morava Brand.
Raw clay sphere.
an homemade hunting decoy, it makes the sound of ...a ghost!
The padlock wasn't forced
The missing coffin lid, we just miss Miss Sanders now.
Formaldehyde. Used to preserve decomposing organic matter.
Sticky and smells like pine resin.
There was a wedding here. With the dead body of Rebecca, partly embalmed. It will kill her mother if she learned that it happened. I should take Rebecca now and get out of this nuthouse.
That must be why they have left the cart.
The lid is missing. Where are thou, Rebecca Sanders.
Fake antiques, best sales for tourist and looking for hidden treasures.
The smell is terrible. Chemical even.
The cemetery caretaker was attracted outside his cabin by the sound of a peculiar hunting decoy. He was hit, twice, in the back by sling bullet of raw clay.
The smell is terrible. Chemical even. Formaldehyde. used to embalm dead bodies.
Formaldehyde. Same as in the coffin.
Empty, as expected...
It's Rebecca. The body smells like...Pine tree?
Tracks in the mud, parallel.
Two parallel traces...
The cart was hidden here, not so far away.
Hey, Boss.
Thanks for the lead.
The baker might soon regret such advertizing.
I shouldn't enter without a pie.
Curiosity killed the cat, and now returned for his nemesis.
He seems well off. Now, who could possibly hate this face enough to plan a murder.
Impressive. I wonder why the rats even keep on struggling.
Appetizing, but deadly. A dangerous combination.
Leftovers from a recent exercize. Let's take a sample.
There we go.
This would take ages to rifle through. I need to be precise.
Only the finest textiles! Come by again!
It's unwise to adopt a disguise in full view of its potential targets.
Definitely not a flavour I prefer.
Oh, the rascal.
Such friendly-looking young men.
The glue'd barely dried up.
Enough here to render twenty kitchens unsafe for cooking.
Nothing noteworthy. Something else, perhaps?
Sure, I'll tell you. But pay attention - you don't wanna get lost in here, Englishman.
Are you buying or leaving? Because it's one or the other.
Please. You're obstructing the view.
I don't know you, and I don't care to know you.
Move along.
Having fun? Good. Piss off and let us have some too.
So good to have you here with us, miss! Whoever you are....
An expensive thing. Clearly custom-made.
Brilliant job, Mr. Holmes! As always.
The bullet hit the heart. He died very quickly.
Here the bullet went out.
These hands haven't experienced much manual work.
The fabric is wrapped very neatly.
Blank cartridges, filled with the red paint. Definitely non-lethal.
But your opponent was in the opposite direction, mister.
Lavender and pine tree scent. An ointment by Dr. Herbert.
The victim was killed by a shooter from the wall. It could be the fourth person, who was waiting for an opportunity to kill the victim.
Empty. Wonder where the revolver is now.
A tricky combination lock. I have only one try, if the code is not right I'll have to crack it to open.
What a pity. Now I can only crack it to see what's inside.
"Justine" by Marquis de Sade, published in 1791. Was read more than a dozen of times.
According to the imprint, it must be a LeMat revolver missing here.
Glass. But good work, if it was not me, they might think they are real.
Claus "Marksman" Feugen, 1843-1892.
The glasses are clean. Someone preferred to drink gin straight out of the bottle.
Only one of the pistol grips is highly polished. Interesting.
Looks like two men entered, but only one left.
A special place for special case. These dueling pistols definitely were the favorite.
In the still mirror of the sea I saw, My image, truly now I do not fear, The rivalry of Daphnis - be thou judge.
Now is the fairest time of all the year, For now the fields and trees bring forth their buds, And leafy are the woods.
Rather tell me where I can find the lands, In which flowers bloom, printed with names of kings.
I didn't do it. You hear me? I'm not a murderer!
Expensive fabric but the coat is worn way down.
Still a bit wet from tears.
